compositeCheatsheet.name: Adding Development Objects to ABAP Project

taskGroup.name: Adding New Development Objects to ABAP Project
taskGroup.intro:
This tutorial demonstrates step by step how to add new development objects to your project using the ABAP Development Tools.
You will also discover that this procedure is a bit different, depending on the object type to be created. Currently, you can create certain development objects such as DDIC tables, structures, or data elements, solely by means of GUI-based tools.
By the end of this tutorial, you will be able to:
> Create regular and exception ABAP classes
> Create ABAP programs
> Assign a transport request
> Create further development objects such as ABAP Dictionary data elements
> Understand the interplay between Eclipse-based and GUI-based tools.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Congratulations, you have successfully completed the sequence of steps required to add new development objects to your ABAP project!

task.name: Creating Global ABAP Classes
task.intro: In this unit, you will become familiar with the steps required for creating gobal ABAP classes.
task.onCompletion: When you create classes, you specify their basic data only. This definition produces an entry in the global class library of the AS ABAP system.

task.name: Creating ABAP Programs
task.intro: This unit shows you how to add new ABAP programs in the specified package.
task.onCompletion: You have created an executable ABAP program.

task.name: Creating ABAP Dictionary Data Elements
task.intro: This unit shows you how to create a data element in the ABAP Dictionary, starting with your ABAP project, followed by the ABAP Development Object creation wizard, and finally completed with the GUI-based Dictionary tool.
task.onCompletion: You have created a data element for your ABAP project.
